data: Metabolic treatment depends on ammonia level

If ammonia level greater than 100 umol/L, and no enchephalopathy:    
- Insert NG-Tube
- Continue with metabolic formula via NG-Tube continuously starting from 10ml/hr 
- Add  IV D10NS ( to a total of 1.5 maintenance)  - Consider intralipid infusion over 24hours  
- Give L- arginine  
- Repeat ammonia in 2H, if ammonia goes up under treatment start scavenger with Ammonul (Na phenylacetate & Na Benzoate according to guidelines) and consider changing oral arginine to IV arginine-HCl. 
 - Monitor electrolytes- Na, K, Cl, Mg, Ca, Phosphate, glucose, acid base and anion gap

If ammonia level greaterr than 100 umol/L, and  / or  encephalopathy:   
- Insert 2 IV lines  
- Stop feeding 
 - Give IV D10NS+ Intralipid ( volume to a total of 1.5 maintenance)  
- Start IV ammonia scavenger with Ammonul (Na Phenylacetate & Na Benzoate) & IV arginine HCl 300mg/kg according to order form.  
- Adjust the volumes of IV D10NS to the infusion rate of Ammonul-Arginine-HCl. (The priming solution is infused at a very high rate requiring adjustment of the rest of the fluid rates. Ammonul also requires additional KCl supplementation.   
- Monitor electrolytes- Na, K, Cl, Mg, Ca, Phosphate, glucose, acid base and anion gap  
- Consult nephrology for potential hemodialysis  
- Repeat ammonia in 2H. If ammonia goes up under treatment patient needs to be commenced on hemodialysis

Valproic acid and haloperidol are contraindicated as they can lead to worsening hyperammonemia
